newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice closes lower on long liquidation.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice closes lower on long liquidation.

text.p: CBOT rice futures closed lower on long liquidation and small lot net new sales as the market continued to track lower values in Asian markets, traders said.
"It was just long liquidation with a few new shorts," a trader said.
Traders said the U.S. cash market now has sagged to nearly even with the CBOT futures. "Farmer selling dried up at $9.80," he said.
Rice closed four to seven cents per cwt lower, with November down five at $9.83 per cwt.
Rice futures volume was estimated at 550 contracts, up from 483 Monday, according to the CBOT.
Rice options volume was estimated at 30 contracts, up from 19 Monday.
